JobFullDesc: In the Critical Environments Instrumentation Technician role (CEIT) you will have an opportunity to work alongside a dynamic team of industry professionals across the Information Technology (IT) and Critical Environments (CE) spectrum within Microsoft 24x7x365 mission-critical datacenters. You will be an Industrial Controls Systems (ICS) subject-matter-expert with accountabilities that include but are not limited to maintaining ICS availability, data quality, service and change management, reporting, and the security of all ICS systems and applications that monitor, control, host, transport, and deliver telemetry.  You will collaborate closely with Microsoft’s local Datacenter Operations teams to maintain ICS high availability and security and provide hands-on escalation support, oversight, and guidance.  You will own site level ICS program and project management, and both govern and directly participate in the execution of global initiatives related to ICS systems.  You will govern logical and physical access, approval, and permissions related to all ICS systems, networks, workstations, and servers that provide datacenter monitoring, controls, and telemetry.  From assisting DC Operations with maintenance & safety procedures (via monitoring system outputs), to operating and maintaining these systems directly, you will be a steward of vital ICS infrastructure. ResponsibilitiesManaging, servicing, and governing Microsoft’s electrical and mechanical industrial control systems (ICS) to include servers, applications, networks, and device infrastructure deployed within Microsoft’s 24x7x365 mission-critical datacenters.  You will be the Lead technical resource for these monitoring and control services, ensuring availability and telemetry for critical electrical and mechanical controls systems. You will be the immediate technical resource and point of escalation for CE vendors for IC Systems.Excellent customer service, interpersonal awareness, and communication skills will be pivotal in
